alert.note: Alert for Rapides; Vernon (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 9:55PM CST until January 16 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CST TUESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM TUESDAY TO 6 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the first Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, additional light ice accumulation on elevated surfaces. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 10 above zero. * WHERE...In Louisiana, Vernon and Rapides Parishes. In Texas, Tyler, Northern Jasper and Northern Newton Counties. * WHEN...For the first Wind Chill Advisory, until 11 AM CST Tuesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until midnight CST tonight. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from 8 PM Tuesday to 6 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Louisiana, call 511 for road information. In Texas, visit www.drivetexas.org for road information.
